fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Setting resolution field as an edit issue action does not set the resolved date of issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule with 2 actions. An Edit issue fields action to set Resolution field, and a Transition Issue action to resolve or close
!image-2020-07-10-03-16-20-179.png|thumbnail! 
# Trigger the automation rule for the issue

h3. Expected Results
Issue is transitioned and Resolution and Resolved date is set successfully

h3. Actual Results
Issue is transitioned and resolution is set, but not resolved date

h3. Workaround
* Set resolution field in the Transition Issue action instead of in the Edit issue fields action
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
or
* Set resolution field with a Update Issue field post-function in your transition, and skip Resolution in the Edit issue fields action entirely.
fields.summary: Setting resolution field as an edit issue action does not set the resolved date of issue

fields.description:
Customers want an easier way of updating A4J rules when something changes on JIRA.

Current scenario:

* Customer have removed a link type from JIRA;
* Rules are still referencing the old link type and are failing when trying to run.
* The current way of fixing that is manually removing the link type.
* Customer have a lot of rules that needs to be updated and they wouldn't like doing that manually for all of them.

As per Daniel's comments:

{quote}
The ideal would be to have an automatic service that runs every specific amount of time and helps updating rules in case of changes in JIRA.

 There are several components that we need to consider (issue links are involved):
 *Triggers:*
 * Link deleted,
 * Issue linked

*Conditions*:
 * Related issues condition

*Branch*:
 * for linked issues

*Actions*
 * Delete issue links
 * Link issue

Also components that could have custom JQL might be also affected (depending on user configuration).

Also when link type is deleted from Jira, user is asked whether to replace link type or to delete links - so there is space to discuss how smart our feature could be (remove or replace). For components with custom JQL we would need to  provide some lexical analysis to check if valid link types are used. It looks tough.

Just thinking loudly now: maybe some kind of recurring health-check, where we could add some routines ?

IMHO it is not as simple as bugfix, so we need to involve project management forces.
{quote}
fields.summary: Automatically find JIRA changes and update A4J rules

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

Currently, the A4J only allows me to link a ticket to the "trigger issue" or the "Most recently created issue".

However, I would like to link all newly created (cloned) issues together.
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Potential Workaround

Currently, A4J doesn't provide a way for linking all the created issues amongst them. 
 They could be linked in pairs in a way that it is trackable.

You have two options for that:
 # Editing each “Clone issue” action you have there and setting the "Issue Links" field with the "Most recently created issue";
 # Or adding a branch for "All created issues" and setting the "Link Issue" action with the "Most recently created issue".

Note that the second option will link all the issues to the last cloned issue, so you might need to have that in mind.

Alternatively, you can add a specific label on each of your cloned issues and build a second rule that is triggered whenever an issue is created with that specific label in a way that you can search for all the issues labeled with the same label and then you remove the label on the same rule, to avoid having duplicates.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: I would like to link issues together among them

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an automation rules contains a webhook action, and if there are any errors related to this action, the result is no notifications are triggered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Automation for Jira 7.1.15
# Setup an Automation Rule, such as the one below:
 !image-2020-06-29-15-35-50-150.png|thumbnail! 
(i) Remember to set "email rule owner everytime rule fails".
# Execute the automation rule.
# Observe that the rule has some errors:
 !image-2020-06-29-15-36-46-480.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Rule owner receives a notification related to failure, similar to one such as below:
 !image-2020-06-29-15-38-05-848.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* No notification emails are received.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround yet.

*Other information*
* Tried to install Automation for Jira 7.1.0, to test whether it used to work for previous version. However, when on this version, audit logs always say that the rule is a success, even though there are failures:
!image-2020-06-29-15-39-55-553.png|thumbnail! 
* Ignore "Affect version" for this ticket, as unable to select 7.1.15.
fields.summary: Automation rules involving webhook errors does not trigger notification

fields.description:
I was working on creating an automation task where we could enforce some quality control in our workflow process by ensuring that the assignee of a task is updated to an internal team member if an external team member transitioned a ticket to a particular status, e.g.
 # John is external developer (one of 3 externals on the team) and transitions ticket to "In Review"
 # John forgot to assign to Karl, who is internal lead developer and need to review John's work against requirements
 # Karl misses the ticket because he only filters by tasks assigned to him and John is working on another ticket

I have the following automation set up:

1.  When issue transitioned from "In Progress" to "In Review"

2. If: Initiator is in group "external-suppliers"

3. And: Assignee is not one of [karl@example.com|mailto:john@example.com]

It is on the condition "And: Assignee..." that I'd like to configure to be "is in group...", and not "is one of..." or "is not one of...".
fields.summary: Allow condition for checking if assignee is/not in group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Projects* field is broken and does not allow users to select multiple projects during a rule's configuration process.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Press the dot (*.*) key twice.
# insert *Automation Rules* in the box that will appear.
# Click on *Create Rule*.
# Click on *Rule details*.
# On *Scope* select *Multiple projects*.
# Attempt to select more than a single project on the *Projects* field.

h3. Expected Results

* You are able to select multiple projects.

h3. Actual Results

* You are only able to select a single project.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Projects field does not accept multiple values while configuring rules in Automation for Jira - Lite
Improve Automation documentation about how to use custom fields with smart values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary



The Use reporter's e-mail domain option to edit the organization is case sensitive, and the behavior is not consistent when the customer's domain changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Manually created Org: "Fake Org"
 - Manually created customer in "Fake Org" with email: "tim@fake.com"
 - Created request from new customer: "TIM2@Fake.com"

 * A4J created new Org: "Fake"

 - Created request from new customer: "TIM3@FAKE.COM"

 * A4J created new Org: "FAKE.COM" didn't expect that, but let's try more

 - Created request from new customer: "tim4@fake.com"

 * A4J added customer to "Fake Org" (matching on existing user)

 - Created request from new customer: "TIM5@FaKe.com"

 * A4J added customer to "Fake" (matching on domain?)

 - Created request from new customer: "Tim6@Fake.Com"

 * A4J added customer to "FAKE.COM" (not sure what this matched on, but I guess the .Com made it fail the same logic the previous case passed).

h3. Expected Results

Only 1 organization, Fake Org, should have been created.

h3. Actual Results

Multiple orgs created
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using Use reporter's email domain in organization field is case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Issue description

If a transition is configured with the following condition, such transition can't be executed by the *transition issue* action:
{code:java}
Condition to hide a transition from the user. The transition can only be triggered from a workflow function{code}
!Screen Shot 2020-06-23 at 10.07.03 AM.png|thumbnail!



When looking into the Audit Log of the automation rule, we can see the following error:
{code:java}
No matching transitions could be found for issues (with current status):
{code}
!Screen Shot 2020-06-23 at 10.07.13 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

Allow hidden transition to be executed by any automation rules.
h3. Workaround

Workaround 1:
 - Replace the hidden condition with the condition *User Is In Project Role* and select "Administrators" (Project Admins will still be able to see the transition but others won't)
 - Set the rule actor to a user who is part of the "Administrators" role in the project

Workaround 2:
 - Create a special group for this rule and add the rule actor to this group
 - Replace the hidden condition with the condition "User is in group" (No other users will see the transition)
fields.summary: Support hidden transitions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

java.lang.ClassCastException errors can occur if A4J and A4J lite are both installed on the same server while A4J Lite is disabled
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install A4J lite
 # Install 'Xporter for Jira app' or 'ScriptRunner' (this bug is not caused by the presence of either of these apps, but they do help to illustrate the issue here).
 # Install A4J (this will automatically disable A4J lite)
 # Try to execute any automation rule in A4J on a Service Desk project

h3. Expected Results

Rule should be executed without errors even with either of the A4J disabled.
h3. Actual Results

Rules fail with the following exception thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.xpandit.jiraxporter.integration.automationforjira.XporterActionIntegration cannot be cast to com.codebarrel.automation.api.thirdparty.AutomationRuleComponent
{noformat}
{noformat}
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.onresolve.scriptrunner.automation.ExecuteScriptIssueActionV2 cannot be cast to com.codebarrel.automation.api.thirdparty.AutomationRuleComponent
{noformat} 


h3. Workaround

*Uninstall* either A4J or A4J Lite

*Note*
 * If you don't initially replicate this issue, restart Jira and the issue should then be reproducible
 * We have not been able to reproduce this issue without Xporter for Jira or ScriptRunner installed
 * We have also only been able to reproduce this on Service Desk projects
fields.summary: ClassCastException when executing automation rules with both A4J and A4J Lite installed

fields.description:
Currently, if an issue triggers an automation and does not meet any of the conditions, then no actions are taken, the automation is considered to have completed successfully and reports in the log as Success.

Depending on the conditions of an automation, the majority of executions may appear in the logs as with the status "Success". While this is an appropriate status, it makes it very difficult to find an event where something actually happened. The only way to find the execution that performed any actions is to open every successful event. The duration hints that actions may have been taken, but is not conclusive.

I suggest a simple Action Count that would help an admin filter in/out the automation executions where actions were taken, or where no action was taken. I suggest leaving no actions blank as opposed to showing "0" so no actions taken rows are more obvious.

To recover space needed in the UI for the above perhaps only the Project code needs to be displayed, not also the full project name.

 

!image-2020-06-05-11-20-25-757.png!

 

Suggested change:

!image-2020-06-05-11-27-04-239.png!
fields.summary: Add a Completed actions count to the audit log

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A few users of both Automation of Jira and the 3rd party, Insights, app have complained about auto-population of Insight objects no longer working on the Action component to set field value in Automation for Jira (when creating a rule).

h3. Environment
* Insights add-on 8.4+
* Automation app 7.1.3+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup any version of Jira with Automation for Jira and latest version of Insights plugin installed
# Define Insight Objects
# Create an Insight custom field with the Insights custom field type of 'Insight Object/s'
# In the Action component of your Automation rule, select your Insight custom field
# Try to type characters into the value field for Insight Objects

h3. Expected Results
Insight Objects should be pre-populated for this field
!image-2020-06-02-16-38-02-089.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2020-06-02-16-35-35-074.png|thumbnail! 
No objects populate even after you start typing
 
h3. Notes
App Vendor has given feedback through one of our customers that the API used to retrieve insight objects have change since 8.4 of the Insights plugin (since March). Apparently we are to now use new API:
{code}
GET /rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects?iql=objectTypeId={id} AND anyAttribute LIKE "<text>"
{code}
instead of old one:
{code}
GET /rest/insight/1.0/objecttype/{id}/objects?query=<text>
{code}

h3. Workaround
You might be able to use the [Advanced field editing \- JSON|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-field-editing-json/] method to set the Insight customfield value. (Expand the *More options* panel)

Example configuration for the rule : 
 !image-2021-03-15-16-38-45-340.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Riada Insight objects no longer auto-populate in set field value screen in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Over the past ~60 days we have seen our DB CPU performance increase each week, and yesterday it pegged at 99% and caused performance issues in the system, mostly related to automation rules, eg rules taking ~30 minutes to apply
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-18 at 10.43.28 AM.png!
 * In thread dumps we saw occasional blocked threads, eg *automation-rule-executor* thread blocking *automation-event-serializer* threads. These blocked threads were not long running between individual dumps, but it's not common for us to see those threads blocked in that way.
 * We observed a high number of the below (parameterized) query running in parallel on the DB:
{code:sql}
select count(*) from "public"."AO_589059_RULE_STAT" "AO_589059_RULE_STAT" where "AO_589059_RULE_STAT"."RULE_ID" = $1 and "AO_589059_RULE_STAT"."EVENT_HASH" = $2
{code}

 * This table maintains audit logging on *Automation for Jira* rules
 * When we ran an explain on this query, we could see that the query planner executed a full table scan for each of these; while individually they aren't _overly_ expensive this really increases CPU overhead when we have multiple queries running in parallel:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-26 at 12.50.13 PM.png|width=704,height=373!
 * The query is using two columns in its WHERE predicate; and we found that there isn't a composite index that covers both conditionals:
{code:none}
Indexes:
    "AO_589059_RULE_STAT_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree ("ID")
    "u_ao_589059_rule_stat_audit_id" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree ("AUDIT_ID")
    "index_ao_589059_rul1515611263" btree ("CREATED")
    "index_ao_589059_rul74196096" btree ("RULE_ID", "CREATED")
    "index_ao_589059_rul995506729" btree ("RULE_ID")
{code}

 * We added a new covering index for this and observed an immediate CPU drop on the cluster:
{code:sql}
CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY "index_ao_589059_rule_id_event_hash" ON "public"."AO_589059_RULE_STAT"("RULE_ID","EVENT_HASH");{code}
(We created the index concurrently to prevent a full write lock on the table, though it only took ~10s)

 * Running the same explain query showed a dramatic decrease in execution time:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-26 at 1.19.30 PM.png|width=849,height=244!
 * DB CPU went immediately back down to normal:
!Screen Shot 2020-05-27 at 4.00.55 PM.png|width=480,height=204!
 * When Node 3 was added back to the cluster the index disappeared and CPU spiked again. The composite index isn't included as part of the Automation for Jira plugin; at startup any indexes not explicitly defined by the plugin are dropped. The indexes themselves are compiled into Java class
 {{automation-for-jira-7.1.7/com/codebarrel/jira/plugin/automation/ao/RuleStat.class}}

 * We've re-added the index and CPU dropped back to expected levels once more

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This is difficult to reproduce artificially. To do so you would need an instance with ~3 million rows in AO_589059_RULE_STAT and lots of traffic that triggers concurrent rule execution.
h3. Expected Results

The queries are performant and do not impact the service
h3. Actual Results

The queries were non performant and caused system impact
h3. Workaround
 * Ensure all nodes are running
 * Add the index to the DB manually:

{code:sql}
CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY "index_ao_589059_rule_id_event_hash" ON "public"."AO_589059_RULE_STAT"("RULE_ID","EVENT_HASH");{code}
 * If any node needs to be restarted, be prepared to manually re-add the index, as the plugin startup will remove it
fields.summary: Expensive AO_589059_RULE_STAT query can cause performance issues

fields.description:
Every automation Rule is configured to work with one or more Projects in Jira.

Configuring a single Rule for multiple projects is manageable.

But eventually most real-world instances end up with many Rules which often applying to the same groups of Projects.

This feature request is to enhance Automation for Jira to allow admins to define *Project Groups* -- each of which has a name, and specifies a set of Projects in Jira.

A Rule would then be configured for one or more Projects and/or Project Groups. This would simplify configuration of (the many) individual rules.

Also, a Project Group can be updated – for example to add a new Project. This would enable all the appropriate Rules for that new Project, greatly simplifying rule administration.

Our Jira instance, for example, currently has 11 automation rules that are configured for the same set of 8 Projects. More Rules, and more Projects, will certainly be added over time. Maintaining the exact same set of Projects across all these Rules is becoming quite burdensome. Our Jira instance is admittedly much smaller than many instances.

A different approach would be to instead implement *Rule Groups*. This would allow leveraging common configuration beyond just the Projects for a Rule. Config elements like "Notify on Error", "Owner" and "Actor" could be part of the Rule Group. A concern with this approach is that not all Rule Groups will want identical config element settings, possibly leading to a need for exceptions (further complicating this approach). The smaller scope of Project Groups is likely an advantage that eliminates the need for exception case handling.
fields.summary: Project Groups or Rule Groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever you configure a rule using the *For Stories (or other issues in Epic)* component, the rule will fail to execute if sub-tasks are disabled on the instance, while recording an error message in the audit log.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable sub-tasks. (*Jira Administration Icon* > *Issues* > *Sub-tasks* > *Disable sub-tasks*)
 # Create a rule that has the *Stories (or other issues in Epic)* component.
 # Execute the rule.

h3. Expected Results

The rule is able to be properly executed.

h3. Actual Results

The rule fails and the following message is displayed:

 !Screen Shot 2020-05-15 at 21.51.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove all sub-task issue types and enable sub-tasks in your instance.
fields.summary: Disabling sub-tasks causes rules using the For Stories (or other issues in Epic) component to fail.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Transition issue* action allows the users to transition an issue based on a destination status, or to select a specific transition to be executed. While *Selecting a specific transition* option we are choosing the specific transition from a specific workflow, however, when executing the rule, the tool seems to only verify the transition ID and ignores from which workflow it belongs to, which can lead to incorrect transitions in other workflows that have the same transition ID.

The problem is reproducible in A4J version 7.1.13.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation Rule with the Transition issue action.
 # Select the *Selecting a specific transition* option.
 # From the list check for repeated transition IDs across different workflows and choose that option.
 # Save the changes and execute the rule.

h3. Expected Results

Only the informed transition from the specific workflow should be executed. In case the transition is not available for the issue, it should throw an error informing that "No matching transitions could be found".
h3. Actual Results

In case the other workflows have a transition with the same ID, the issue is transitioned to the new status.
h3. Example

The rule was created to transition issues with the Cancel(ID 101) transition for the Incident workflow. On the test, we also have the Cancel transition for the Problem(also ID 101) and for the Problem(ID 141) workflows.
 * ISP-55 - Problem
 * ISP-56 - Incident
 * ISP-57 - Change

The expected result would be that only ISP-56 is moved, which is not the case as we can see below.

*Automation Rule:* 
 *!Rule.png|thumbnail!*

*Audit Logs:*
 *!Logs.png|thumbnail!*

*Correct Transition:*
 *!Correct Transition.png|thumbnail!*

*Other transitions:*
 !Other Transitions.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira incorrectly transitions issue based on Workflow ID

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Automation for Jira only allows issue linking to issues in the same instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement remote issue link

h3. Why this is important
This allows issue linking to other instances as well as Confluence pages, etc
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround as of now
fields.summary: Implement remote issue link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a rule that is triggered by the *Fields changed* trigger while looking for changes in the 'Team' Portfolio field, we are getting inconsistent results depending on how the action is executed.
 *Rule example:*
 !Test automation.png|thumbnail!

When changing the Team associated with the issue, we are able to capture the old and new team names with the *fieldChange* smart value(both within Advanced Roadmaps plan and on the issue edit page).
 !Edit.png|thumbnail!

When creating a new issue form within the Advance Roadmap plan and associating a team name at the same time, we are also able to capture the team name.
 !CreateSucc.png|thumbnail!

However, when creating an issue from the default create an issue page and also selecting a Team value, instead of capturing the name of the team, we are capturing the ID of the team.
 !CreateFail.png|thumbnail!

Important note, at all times the value that is stored in the JSON of the issue seems to be the team ID, when searching for the backend information we do not see any mentions to the Team name.

*Smart value utilized:*
{noformat}
{{fields.Team}}{noformat}
{noformat}
{{fieldChange.fromString}}{noformat}
{noformat}
{{fieldChange.toString}}{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Steps to reproduce in the Advanced Roadmaps side:*
{quote} # Go to the Portfolio plan.
 # Click on *Create issue* and input the *summary*.
 # Select the *Team*.
 # Click on *Review changes*.
 # Keep everything checked and hit *Save selected changes in Jira*.{quote}
*Steps to reproduce in the Jira side:*
{quote} # Have the Team field showing up on the create an issue screen.
 # Have a shared team created in Advanced Roadmaps.
 # Hit create issue, and while creating the issue select a team value.{quote}
h3. Expected Results

Get the team name regardless of how the filed was filled.
h3. Actual Results

The results depend on how the field was filled.
h3. Workaround

To be able to capture the Team name it is necessary to first create the issue then edit it, or create it with the associated team from within an Advance Roadmap plan.
fields.summary: Field changed trigger in the Jira Advanced Roadmaps 'Team' yields inconsistent results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to send a web request from Jira Server to Jira Cloud. The following error is returned and it is not possible to publish the rule. 

!a4j-servertocloud.png|thumbnail!

h3. Step to reproduce
# In the Cloud instance, create a new rule
# Configure the Trigger with 'Incoming webhook'
# Copy the _Webhook URL_ for later use
# Go to the Server instance and create a new rule
# Configure any Trigger and the Action would be 'Send web request'
# Use the webhook URL generated from step 3
# Publish the rule

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow 'Send web request' when the 'Incoming webhook' is from a Jira Cloud instance. 

h3. Why this is important
The breaks the integration between Server and Cloud instances.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround available as of now. 

h3. Note
The 'Send web request' works when the 'Incoming webhook' is from another Jira Server instance.
fields.summary: Allow 'Send web request' to Jira Cloud from Jira Server

fields.description:
Currently you can only copy it, or set based on the reporter's domain.

Would be good to create new ones though, or copy organization from another field.

(i) Duplicate of https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-673 for public to watch.
fields.summary: Ability to set Organization field based on smart-value

fields.description:
It would be very powerful to be able delay the execution of a rule.
E.g.

* 4 hours after issue is created, run rule.
* 1 week after issue is resolved

A "Delay" action may work here.
fields.summary: Support the ability to delay a trigger/rule execution

fields.description: Automation for Jira can do many things that a custom script could do, but it doesn't allow for storing data as variables to be used again later in the rule.  There are occasions where this would greatly improve the efficiency and simplicity of a rule, especially for rules that send multiple web requests.  Perhaps the rule creator/admin could be allowed to set a name for the variable and access it like a smart value.
fields.summary: Set variables for use later in automation rule

fields.description:
*Description*
We would like to suggest for a feature which allows the rule creator to have a "Dry Run" of the rules. It would ideally involve some of the following items:
# User creates some rules.
# A feature to test the rules (knowing the outcome via audit logs), before enabling the rule.
fields.summary: Include a Dry Run feature for Automation Rules

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
We released new set of trigger called DevOps [New automation triggers across Jira, Bitbucket and Github!|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-articles/New-automation-triggers-across-Jira-Bitbucket-and-Github/ba-p/1337351]. But this is now only available in Cloud instance. 

(i) At the moment, the DevOps category is available, but no triggers under this option yet. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have this available for Server and Data Center too.
fields.summary: Having DevOps trigger in Server/Data Center

fields.description: Allow webhook payload to also send attachments.
fields.summary: Allow webhook to send attachments

fields.description: Currently, it is not possible to dynamically set the Epic Link field by retrieving information from issues (for instance, the project key), as a Jira Admin, I would like to be able to use smart values into the Epic Link field, to assign newly created issues to the Epic related to their respective project.
fields.summary: Allow the Epic Link field to be dynamically set.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The [Automation for Jira - Server|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira-server?hosting=server&tab=overview] app is marked as compatible up to version 8.7.1 despite having version 8.8.0 released. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the compatibility of the app to the latest versions of Jira
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround as of now
fields.summary: Compatibility with latest version of Jira

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

 

I'm in Customer Success for Liberty Mutual. Our customers (other Liberty employees) are requesting an addition to the Automation Plug in.

 

They are requesting "On Clone" to be a trigger for their automation.

 

Please feel free to follow up with questions or feedback.

 

Thank you!

Lauren
fields.summary: "On Clone" as Automation trigger

fields.description:
The *Epic Link* field was not added as an option in the *Field Value Changed* trigger because of the following bug:

[JSWSERVER-12299 - Change in Epic Link field does not trigger listener|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12299]

However, the bug has been fixed in Jira Software 8.4.2 and 8.5.0 versions. Would we be able to add the Epic Link field back as a native option for this particular trigger?
fields.summary: Add the "Epic Link" field as a native option for the *Field Value Changed* trigger in Automation for Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Multiple issues events trigger lets you choose various different events to run an automation rule based off of (Issue created, Issue assigned, Issue Closed, etc).  However it does not include the "Manual trigger" option.  Perhaps this is intentional as the Manual trigger is technically not an issue event.

h3. Suggested Solution
Permit the Manual trigger to be one of the options in the multiple issue events type trigger

h3. Why this is important
Simplifies the number of rules, prevents users from creating nearly duplicate rules
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, you would have to clone the existing multiple issue events rule and then change the trigger.  Not ideal as it creates additional work to update later on
fields.summary: When using a Multiple issue events trigger, there should be an option to also include Manual trigger

fields.description:
Would like to see the following functionality supported within JSD or within Jira Automations:

If a user creates a ticket between business hours (e.g. 9-5 M-F) then add a comment to the ticket with a canned response.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Ticket Auto-reply Outside of Business Hours

fields.description: Please consider replacing the word "Component" in Automation rules with something else, like "module" or "element". "Component" already has a separate meaning in Jira.

h3. Issue Summary
From https://blog.codebarrel.io/permissions-for-project-automation-7e17c5c8cbb3, users who are given project admin role should have permission to edit rules. However, if the rule is associated to more than 1 project, then this user is not able to do any edits eventhough the user is admin for all those projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Define a rule with scope for Proj_A and Proj_B
# Ensure that User_A is not a Jira / Global administrator.
# Give User_A project administration role for Proj_A and Proj_B.

h3. Expected Results
* User_A is able to edit the rule.

h3. Actual Results
* User_A is not able to edit the rule

h3. Workaround
No known workaround yet.
fields.summary: Project admin unable to edit rule if rule is associated to more than 1 projects.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Custom fields provided by apps are not available to be picked on the *Edit Issue* automation. It is only possible to change such fields by using JSON as described in the KB article below:
* [Advanced field editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/advanced-field-editing-993924663.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
Have all custom fields show up, even those provided by other apps.
 
h3. Workaround 
Follow the steps in the KB article [Advanced field editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/advanced-field-editing-993924663.html] to specify the chosen custom field using JSON.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to pick any custom field when setting up an 'Edit Issue' automation, without having to use JSON

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user on Jira DC 8.3 or greater navigates to the Content Delivery Network page, the Automation for Jira plugin produces a warning of possible incompatibility with CDN usage.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Jira DC instance 8.3 or greater, open the Content Delivery Network page (Jira Administration> System > Advanced > Content Delivery Network).
 # Notice a card warning user of A4J compatibility with the CDN.
 # Tried with A4J version 6.0.16 installed and also upgraded to 7.1.5. Both had same issue.

h3. Expected Results

A4J can be used on Jira instances using CDNs.
h3. Actual Results

On the Content Delivery Network Screen a card with the following text was shown to the user:

"
User-installed apps may not be compatible
The following apps rely on deprecated code which can lead to problems when caching assets. * [Automation for Jira|https://itops-testing.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/upm?fragment=manage%2Fcom.codebarrel.addons.automation]

"

See attached screenshot.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround.
fields.summary: When viewing the CDN page for Jira, the Automation For Jira plugin gives a warning as possibly incompatible

fields.description:
+*Summary*+
Similar to Jira Service Desk, when choosing the action to send an email, we would like to have a feature that includes a translation in different languages for email templates generated from Automation for Jira.
fields.summary: Provide Translations for emails templates generated from Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The "For Linked Issues" branch does not work for one specific direction when issue is cloned, and the audit logs show "The following issues did not match the condition:".

 !image-2020-03-20-16-03-26-445.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a rule as per [^image-2020-03-20-16-03-26-445.png] .
# Trigger the rule by creating a "clone" issue from AUT project.


h3. Expected Results
# Automation should work because the rule condition is "For Linked Issues".

h3. Actual Results
# If the default link is for example "Blocks", [^image-2020-03-20-16-08-40-188.png], then the rule fails.
# However, if the link is the other direction "Is blocked by", [^image-2020-03-20-16-10-25-363.png] then the rule is OK. 

h3. Workaround

None known yet.
fields.summary: "For Linked Issues" branch rule does not work on certain directions when cloning.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Rules that span across multiple projects now also showing up in Project rules from version 7.1.3 and onwards. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Automation for Jira 7.1.3+ 
# Create rules for multiple projects (non-global)
# Check Project Automation -> Project Rules 

h3. Expected Results
Should only show rules specific for the project and not multiple project rules (this should go into Global Rules label).

h3. Actual Results
Project Rules show multi-project rules as well as Global Rules showing the same.
 !7.1.3.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Downgrade to version 7.1.2 which will restrict Multi-project rules to the Global Rules label only.
Where it will now only show just the project rule -
 !7.1.2.png|thumbnail! 
and multi-project rules can only be seen in Global rules -
 !global.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Multi-project rules showing up in Project Rules label

fields.description: Please consider replacing the word "Component" in Automation rules with something else, like "module" or "element". "Component" already has a separate meaning in Jira.
fields.summary: Change Component Terminology

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a global rule via Automation Server Lite, the wheel is stuck at spinning and there is an error message.

The error message can be seen below:
 !image-2020-03-17-22-17-18-600.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Automation Server Lite 7.1.3
 # Create any global rule.

h3. Expected Results
Referring to https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/getting-the-right-version-993924597.html#Gettingtherightversion-provslite, the expected outcome would be users are able to Save and execute global rules.

h3. Actual Results
Error message appears, and the rule does not save.

h3. Workaround
Downgrade to Automation Lite 7.1.2

(i) Note that the current affect version is marked as 7.1.2 because am unable to select 7.1.3.
fields.summary: When creating a global rule via Automation Server Lite, the wheel is stuck at spinning and there is an error message.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using action "Edit issue" to set Resolution does not set the resolution date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create automation rule with Manual Trigger
# Set the action for Edit Issue, indicating a valid resolution.
# Save the changes.  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Trigger the automation on an issue.

h3. Expected Results
The issue gets the resolution set, and the resolution date gets reflected automatically.

h3. Actual Results
The resolution is set, but no resolution date is reflected.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using action Edit issue to set Resolution does not set the resolution date.

fields.description:
Currently, there are no smart value to capture the user who has deleted an issue in Jira using automation

 

It will be great if there are smart value for issue deletion as well to capture the user who deleted a particular issue
fields.summary: Smart value for issue deletion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, the profile visibility options to allow *Only You and Admins* is only applicable to email address:
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow *Only You and Admins* options for other fields and full name
h3. Why this is important

Users would want to share their information with Admin only but not the entire organization.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Allow Only You and Admin options for Full name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User provisioning not updating the account <--> group association in a specific scenario. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new user in Azure - make sure it is disabled
 # Create a group in Azure and assign this group to the user
 # Assign "Atlassian Cloud" app to the group created in step 2
 # User provisioning will create the Group in Atlassian but user will not be added to it as Azure will say the object is not active in source
 # Enable the user in Azure
 # User provisioning will not change anything in Atlassian
 # I had to do on demand provisioning for the user - this did create the user in Atlassian but in default group (all members ...) but not in the group to which user is added in Azure!

h3. Expected Results

Account should be added to the group once the user is enabled in Azure
h3. Actual Results

Account is not added to the expected group
h3. Workaround

Re-add the user to the impacted group in Azure (and do an on-demand provisioning)
fields.summary: User provisioning not updating the group - account association

fields.description: Allow user login while blocking [referrers|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Referrer-Policy], this way allowing users to enhance their privacy by using user.js configuration files such as [arkenfox|https://github.com/arkenfox/user.js]
fields.summary: Allow user login while blocking referrers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to review list of conflict accounts for GSuite sync.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
-  Connect your organization with a GSuite setup
- Run the GSuite sync
- When a conflict is encountered the following message will be returned. 
{quote}
Unable to sync an account in your organization
....
....
Review account list
{quote}

- Click on  *Review account list*


h3. Expected Results

The list of accounts that needs to be resolved should be generated. 

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when clicking on the link. 


h3. Workaround

Please contact Atlassian support to help generate the list from the backend.
fields.summary: Review list for GSuite sync does not return anything

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user has access to more than 100 products the App Switcher on Jira throws a 500 error when trying to retrieve the list. The same behavior happens when accessing https://start.atlassian.com

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Add an account to more than 100 sites;
# Try to either use the App Switcher or access https://start.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results

The list will show all results or be truncated.

h3. Actual Results

A 500 error happens in the following endpoint:
{code}gateway/api/available-products/api/available-products{code}
This will be displayed on admin.atlassian.com, on the Cloud site and at start.atlassian.com

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: App Switcher return a 500 error if the user has access to more than 100 products.
Disable users ability to change avatars/profile picture

fields.description:
Implement REST API to control email visibility of users

Users have the option to select below for email visibility under their profile settings:
 * Anyone can see
 * Only visible to people in org
 * Only you and the admins

Providing API to control this setting would help org admins to implement consistent policies across the organization.
fields.summary: Implement REST API to control email visibility of user

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Create a REST API call to set the user profile image (avatar image).

This would help bulk upload of avatar and allow admins to control Avatar picture for users
fields.summary: Implement REST API to upload an avatar picture

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [SCIM API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/intro/] has no reference to the time taken propagating changes into the Atlassian cloud site. This can be misleading to developers who are expecting to see the changes once they receive a successful response code from the SCIM API calls. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use the SCIM APIs to create group or users data. 

h3. Expected Results

The group & user changes to the Atlassian cloud site is not immediate but this should be documented on the [SCIM API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/intro/] documentation

h3. Actual Results

Behavior is not documented. 

h3. Workaround

Wait for a minute for the changes to reflect in the Atlassian cloud site.
fields.summary: SCIM : Document the propagation time of changes to the site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User Management does not show the activity at Jira Work Management of a user. 
For example, *Directory* > *Users* shows the 'last active' of a user to be Dec 14, 2021.
!image-2021-12-15-16-46-22-692.png|width=400! 
However clicking on the user, it only shows Jira Software with 'Last active' to be Dec 10, 2021.
 !image-2021-12-15-16-47-17-445.png|width=400! 
The same is shown in the user CSV export .
 !image-2021-12-15-16-47-26-089.png|width=400! 

Jira Work Management activity is being disregarded in the user detail's activity view and CSV export.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira-only site on a new organization
 # Only access Jira Work Management projects https://<Site-name>.atlassian.net/jira/core/projects/<Project-Name>

h3. Expected Results

User activity should include Jira Work Management activity (last seen) on the user details and CSV export.
h3. Actual Results

User activity is not included Jira Work Management activity (last seen) on the user details and CSV export.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Work Management last seen activity is not shown in the User Management on Jira only site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Invite emails should respect Jira site settings language setting or the users language preferences (if available)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Jira language site settings to anything other than English.
 # Invite someone to the site

h3. Expected Results

You should receive an email with the 'subject <user> has invited you to join them' but this should be in the language set in the Jira site preferences. The body of the email should also be in the language set in the Jira site preferences.
h3. Actual Results

You receive an email in English rather than in your preferred language.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Invite emails do not respect Jira language settings or User language settings.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can use the option *Suggest changes* when viewing an user in the site-administration to suggest changes to the user's Name or/and Email address.

When suggesting changes to the Name, the email received redirects the user to the Email section instead of the Profile and visibility section (where you can change the name).
 !Screen Shot 2021-12-09 at 13.47.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access an user of your Jira/Confluence instance in the administration
* Click on *Suggest changes*
* Enter a a new suggested value for the *Name* only


h3. Expected Results

The user will receive an email about the suggested change, redirecting them to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility
 !Screen Shot 2021-12-09 at 13.49.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The email is received, but clicking on *Change details* will redirect the user to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/email instead
 !Screen Shot 2021-12-09 at 13.49.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Suggested changes email redirects to wrong section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you attempt to authenticate using basic authentication with a password, or an invalid token, you get the below error message in return, which returns an invalid link to the deprecation notice:
{quote}Basic authentication with passwords is deprecated. For more information, see: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deprecation-of-basic-authentication-with-passwords-for-jira-and-confluence-apis-972355348.html]
{quote}
The link redirects you to Atlassian Cloud Documentation blog posts instead: ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog]) 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

To reproduce the error message that contains the invalid URL, authenticate improperly:
{code:json}
smackie@xxxxxxxxx ~ % curl -D- \
   -u shannon.TEST@TEST.com:####### \
   -X GET \
   -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
   https://gudetama.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/space
HTTP/2 401
server: AtlassianProxy/1.19.3.1
content-type: text/plain
strict-transport-security: max-age=315360000; includeSubDomains; preload
date: Fri, 03 Dec 2021 15:00:53 GMT
atl-traceid: db4809dadf37284a
x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block
x-content-type-options: nosniff
expect-ct: report-uri="https://web-security-reports.services.atlassian.com/expect-ct-report/global-proxy", enforce, max-age=86400

Basic authentication with passwords is deprecated.  For more information, see: https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deprecation-of-basic-authentication-with-passwords-for-jira-and-confluence-apis-972355348.html{code}
h3. Expected Results

The error message should point users to the correct deprecation notice and not redirect to the Cloud blog release notes.
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-basic-auth-and-cookie-based-auth/]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-basic-auth/]

h3. Actual Results

The deprecation notice URL sends users to the Atlassian Cloud Documentation blog posts instead: ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog]) 
h3. Workaround

Refer users to the following URLs:
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-basic-auth-and-cookie-based-auth/]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-basic-auth/]
fields.summary: Password authentication deprecation error in REST-API uses outdated URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[User provisioned|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] groups are not syncing properly to sites beneath the [Organization|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/what-is-an-atlassian-organization/] due to an issue in the microservice that handles the group mapping. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
We're not sure yet how this can be reproduced but the symptoms are:
- Orgs are in the  [new admin UI|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592]. 
- The default group *All members for directory - <directory-id>* is not blocked for manual edition at the Org. 
- No [resolve group conflict when syncing users|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/resolve-group-conflicts-when-syncing-users/] is prompt, despite the *All members for directory* existing in the site but not being linked to the external directory one.

h3. Expected Results
Groups get synced from the external directory to the site. 

h3. Actual Results
Groups are not synced to the site. 

h3. Workaround
Raise a support ticket.
fields.summary: User provisioning synced groups are not being added to the site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User status still displays *No Activity* even after the user already logged in to the instance. When open their profile , it show {*}Never seen on this site{*}{*}{*}
User has logged in and accessed the product Jira Service Management

 h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As site-admin , invite a user
# Go to the user email inbox, he should receive invitation email from JIRA
# Complete the registration and login to the instance.
# Create an issue or view any issue


h3. Expected Results
User status from User Management page doesn't show "No Activity" and in the profile updated with Last Seen information



h3. Actual Results
User status from User Management page show "No Activity" and in the profile show "Never seen on this site"

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to impersonate Jira Service Management user, getting "You cannot log in as a user that has never accessed this site"

fields.description:
*Summary*
- After deleting a user from a Jira/Confluence instance, this user is still showing on the People Directory. Additionally, if we try to click on the user to see its profile we get an error message saying: "Something went wrong. We keep track of these errors, but feel free to contact us if refreshing doesn’t fix things."

*Environment*
- Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Interact with a user to make it appear in the People Directory page
# Remove the user from the instance
# Go to the People Direct page again

*Expected Results*
- The user won't show in the People Directory page after being removed from the instance

*Actual Results*
- The user is still appearing in the People Directory page and if you click on it you will be redirected to a page showing the message: "Something went wrong. We keep track of these errors, but feel free to contact us if refreshing doesn’t fix things."

*Workaround*
- Interact with other users to change the ones that appear in the People Directory page.
fields.summary: Deleted users keep showing on People Directory and it's not possible to see its profile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If site access for an Atlassian account was revoked manually via the *Has access on site* toggle, if that account is synced via SCIM user provisioning and activated/reactivated, the *Has access on site* toggle has to be switched back on manually for the account to regain site/product access.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This was reproduced using Okta as the identity provider but has not yet been tested with other integrations.

# Revoke site access manually for an Atlassian account via the *Has access on site* toggle in *Products -> User Management -> Users*.
# Deactivate or unassign the user from the Atlassian Cloud application at the identity provider.
#- This results in the Atlassian account being deactivated as expected.
# Reactivate or reassign the user in the Atlassian Cloud application at the identity provider.
#- This reactivates the Atlassian account and adds them to the assigned groups that grant product access as expected.
#- However, the *Has access on site* toggle remains off and the account cannot actually access products on that site until an administrator grants them site access manually.

h3. Expected Results

An Atlassian account that is synced via SCIM and activated should not only be reactivated, but should also be granted site access if it had been revoked manually so that an administrator does not have to grant them access manually.

h3. Actual Results

The Atlassian account is reactivated and added to the groups that grant product access. However, the *Has access on site* toggle remains off and the account cannot actually access products on that site until an administrator grants them site access manually.

h3. Workaround

For any accounts with this issue an administrator for that site needs to toggle *Has access on site* on manually in *Products -> User Management -> Users*.
fields.summary: activating/reactivating a user in the identity provider does not automatically grant site access at Atlassian if site access had been previously revoked manually

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to configure Jira administrator group on new product access configuration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a site with the new improved user management experience
 # Go to the product list
 # Jira Administrator does not appear as a product

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to configure a group as a Jira admin group.
h3. Actual Results

The product list does not allow the admin to configure the product access and group for Jira Administration.

 
h3. Workaround
 # Go to Directory > Groups and open the the {*}jira-admins{*}{*}<sitename>{*} group
 # Select the ... menu at the end of the 'product' list, and select *View product details* 
!Screen Shot 2021-12-01 at 9.45.22 am.png|width=563,height=233!
 # On the Jira Administration page, add extra groups to allow those groups to be product admins, or manage the existing groups
!Screen Shot 2021-12-01 at 9.46.39 am.png|width=533,height=184!
fields.summary: Unable to view and configure Jira administrator on new product list

fields.description:
*Current Scenario*

- Groups from third party IDP can be provisioned into Confluence cloud via Atlassian Access.
- At scale, some groups might unintentionally be deleted from the IDP causing the group on Confluence cloud to also be wiped out. 
- These deleted groups maybe used for permission settings in Confluence. 
- When restoring the group on the third party IDP, a new group will provisioned to Confluence cloud. 

*Problem*

The re-provisioned  group will be assigned a new group ID on the Confluence cloud site and the permission from the deleted group cannot be restored. 

*Suggestion*

Allow to restore deleted groups and restore the permissions attached to them in Confluence. (ie. soft delete of groups)
fields.summary: Ability to restore permissions for deleted groups.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When using the REST API to activate/deactivate, email notifications aren't triggered: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-lifecycle-disable-post
* Email notifications are triggered if the org. admin deactivates/activates Atlassian accounts using the org. admin UI(admin portal - https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<org_id>/members)

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add path parameter to enable email notifications when activating/deactivating Atlassian accounts using the REST API

h3. Why this is important
* Sometimes it is useful for end users to be notified that their Atlassian account has been activated/deactivated
* Admins. usually prefer to automate account activations/deactivations where possible, but want users to be informed of changes to their account
 
h3. Workaround 
* Manually deactivate/activate accounts on the Atlassian org. UI > Managed accounts page
fields.summary: Send notification emails when activating/deactivating Atlassian accounts via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem
h3. Steps to Reproduce :
 # Navigate to system>>Global permissions

h3. Expected Results :

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JSM users are getting an unauthorized error when they click the 'Sign in' button on the top right of an anonymous space.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM customer. He should have an Atlassian Account.
 # Login to [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] using the JSM customer credentials.
 #  Access any anonymous space in another tab in the same browser.
 # Click the 'Sign in' button on the top right of this space.
 # The user will get an error saying that he does not have access to the instance. 

This may be confusing to the user and he will have to click the 'Log out' link to access the login page.
h3. Expected Results

The JSM customer should be logged into the application or shown a login page when he clicks the 'Sign in' button on the top right of the anonymous Space. Also, the tooltip can be modified to include the site name also. For example 'Sign in to mysite.atlassian.net'.
h3. Actual Results

The JSM customer is shown an error screen when he clicks the 'Sign in' button on the top right of the anonymous space.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. However, the user can click the 'Log out' link in the error screen to get to the login page.
fields.summary: JSM users are getting an unauthorized error when they click 'Sign in' button on the top right of an anonymous space.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Under certain circumstances, it is possible for the {{atlassian-addons-admin}} group to be removed from the "Administer Jira" permission.

When this happens, apps cannot perform any of the functionalities that require such permission even if the {{admin}} scope is correctly set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Not available

So far we haven't been able to determine which conditions can lead to this.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

The group cannot be added by an admin. If you believe your site might be affected, please reach out to the Atlassian Customer support team.
fields.summary: The atlassian-addons-admin group can be removed from the Administer Jira permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a site has a large number of users (beyond 20,000), applying group and product filters when exporting users fails with a *504* error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to [*Admin Panel*|https://admin.atlassian.com/] > *Users*
 # Click on *Export users*
 # With the _Users from selected groups only:_ select a group.
 # Select *Only active users*
 # Check *Product access* within _Additional Data_

The above will cause the relevant filters to be applied to the user list. When the user list is significantly large (over the *20,000* limit noted in the [Cloud Plans|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/pricing]), the action can then result in a failed export.
h3. Expected Results

The data is filtered and is exported so that users are able to download it.
h3. Actual Results

If system limitations are exceeded, this can result in an error whereby a *HTTP 504* response is returned and the export fails.

Viewing the request within a browser's dev console/network tab should show the error:
{noformat}
Request URL: https://admin.atlassian.com/gateway/api/adminhub/um/site/<orgID>/users/export
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 504 

{includeApplicationAccess: true, includeGroups: false, includeInactiveUsers: false,…}
includeApplicationAccess: true
includeGroups: false
includeInactiveUsers: false
selectedGroupIds: ["<groupID>"]
0: "<groupID>"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Exporting users filtered by group within Admin hub fails

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you remove a user from the site and then invite the user again, the status at the user management will be ''Active" instead of the "Invited" at user management.

 # Remove a user from the site
 # Invite the user again

h3. Expected Results
The account status at the user management should be "Invited"

h3. Actual Results
The account status will be "Active"
 !image-2021-11-10-11-59-39-892.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Account Status not being correctly displayed at User Management when invited a user after remove the user.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User provisioning documents don't provide details for user attribute mappings.

When configuring user provisioning with Azure customers follow:

[https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-provisioning-tutorial]

[https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/]
 * Step 2 in Azure documentation does not provide information on finding *Tenant URLs* if the user provisioning directory is already configured. It provides info on finding Tenant URLs while creating a new directory
 * Step 5.9 mentions reviewing user attribute mapping but does not provide details on how these attributes would impact the integration. This is missing:

 # Detail on what values can be mapped to "{*}emails[type eq "work"].value{*}" attribute and how would it impact the user's Atlassian accounts. 
 # Details on ensuring primary email address should match the email address mapped to Unique User identifier value if the customer has SSO enabled.
fields.summary: Improve user provisioning documentation

fields.description:
In the app switcher, a user can get a recommendation to join a different site if their domain is whitelisted on that site.

this creates confusion for users and controversy for site admins because the content of their site is being altered by an admin of another site

h4. Context: 
* If user1@*domain.com* has access to site X, 
* If the site-admin of site Y whitelisted *domain.com*
* When user1 opens the *app switcher*, they see a prompt to join site Y, even if they are not a user there:
 !Projects_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Remove the Join section in the App Switcher

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After import a banner is showing asking to review groups, however trying to review groups will throw an error message "group <groupID> does not have write access" when the group is SCIM synced
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Issue reported from creating a sandbox on a instance that has the new org level (no site admins)
h3. Expected Results

Being able to approve product access on the groups
h3. Actual Results

An error is shown saying the group is read only
h3. Workaround

No workaround as of this moment
fields.summary: Unable to review group import from external IDP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a managed user uses social login/continue with Google option to log in to Atlassian and when the Google account id is changed at the user end, Atlassian account email id also gets synced and the account becomes unmanaged.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Claim a domain and use a managed account @manageddomain.com to login to the Atlassian site
# Use social login/Login with Google and use the same managed account email id to access Atlassian sites
# Update the account email id in Google to @gmail.com
# The managed user account email id gets updated from @manageddomain.com to @gmail.com 

h3. Expected Results
Even with the updates to the Google account, managed account should not get updated to an unmanaged account

h3. Actual Results
With the Atlassian account sync, managed account changes to unmanaged account

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: With social login, a managed account is updated to an unmanaged account when Atlassian account syncs with the Google account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting a user at Azure AD does not deactivate the user at the Atlassian directory and the SCIM data is orphaned for the user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sync a user with Azure AD to the Atlassian directory via user provisioning.
 # Delete the user directly under the Active directory and not from the Atlassian Cloud application.
 # This will remove the user from the "Users and group" assignment at the Atlassian Cloud application on Azure.
 # Over the next provisioning cycle, Azure does not send any event to Atlassian to deactivate the user, the user stays active in Atlassian and the SCIM data is orphaned.

Tested the same scenario with Okta and it works fine with Okta. With Okta you get a delete option for the user only after deactivating the user. So no issues here.

Observed this behavior working with customers where they delete user accounts more often while changing users from external to internal employees. Tested same in the lab.
h3. Expected Results

The user should get deactivated over the next provisioning cycle.
h3. Actual Results

The user stays active and the SCIM data also stays linked.
h3. Workaround

Run manual provision on-demand after deleting the user from AD. This will deactivate the user at the Atlassian directory.
fields.summary: Deleting provisioned user at AD does not deactivate the user on Atlassian

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently IDP doesn't allow authentication for other than Atlassian Cloud products.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change IDP so that authentication for platforms/apps other than Atlassian Cloud products can be done.
fields.summary: Use Atlassian Cloud as IDP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Creator of a Vortex Org shows permanently as being "invited" status in Directory Users.
No matter if they resend the invite and follow the links, the status will not change for the user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Vortex site by any means.
 # Observe the user status
 # Attempt to rectify the status by resending an invitation and following the link

h3. Expected Results
- The user status changes to "active"

h3. Actual Results
- The user status remains "invited"

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround, however, this can be safely ignored as the user will continue to have access as expected.
fields.summary: Creator of a Vortex Org shows permanently as being "invited" status in Directory Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Presently, site-admins have no way to restrict REST API access or view usage. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a REST API sub-tab in the *Application Access* screen
https://example.atlassian.net/admin/apps

And display/group the users that have explicit *API access* 
https://example.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig

I think if a user is added to the developers group, API access would automatically be granted. Otherwise, there is no reason to provide all users with API access unless its required and sanctioned by a site-admin.
fields.summary: As a site-admin, I want to control REST API usage with Application Access

fields.description: 'All members for directory' group is created on Organization level when setting up user provisioning, yet it is no longer created/synced to Cloud site.
fields.summary: 'All members for directory' default provisioning group is no longer created in cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old site-admin UI it was displayed under [https://admin.atlassian.com/s/]<cloud-id>/jira-service-desk/portal-only-customers (or Site-admin > *Jira Service Management*).

-The [new User Management UI|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592] does not have *Portal customers* menu/page, therefore, org/product admins can't make changes to those accounts through the new UI.-

The [new User Management UI|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592] does not have the *Portal customers* menu/page easily accessible, it's down in old location:
 # Select *Products* in the admin.atlassian.com navigation
 # From the left menu, under Site & Products select the *site name* you want to navigate to
 # Then select *Jira Service Management* from the left menu

h3. Suggested Solutions

Migrate that menu/page to the new UI as well.
h3. Workaround

Access the old UI directly at [https://admin.atlassian.com/s/]<cloud-id>/jira-service-desk/portal-only-customers. Or navigate there:
 # Select *Products* in the admin.atlassian.com navigation
 # From the left menu, under Site & Products select the *site name* you want to navigate to
 # Then select *Jira Service Management* from the left menu
fields.summary: New User Management UI does not have JSM portal accounts page

fields.description:
API tokens can be generated for each Atlassian Account to be able to use with Jira and Confluence cloud APIs. At the moment, the tokens does not expire unless revoked by the end user or by the org admins. 

Suggestion :

Provide a life span for any new api tokens that are generated. (ie. 1 week, 1year, unlimited) for an Atlassian Account.
fields.summary: API token expiration

fields.description:
Adding a user to the Org without sending an email invite updates the Invitation status as Invited.
h3. Steps to reproduce:

*Scenario 1:*
 # Log in to admin.atlassian.com
 # From your organization, go to Directory > Users.
 # Select Invite users
 # Enter the Email address you want the user to log in with
 # Grant product access
 # Deselect Send invitation option
 # Select Invite user(s).

*Scenario 2:*

Migrate users into the organization (e.g. server to cloud migration).
h3. Expected Result:

Invitation Status should be Invited - Invitation not sent
h3. Actual Result:

Invitation Status will be set to Invited.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Inviting a user without an email invite sets the Invitation status as Invited

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this current point in time there is no way for marketplace vendors to access the profile of the Atlassian Account of the user associated to their app. Therefore, in order to change display name or avatar picture or any other detail of the users  associated to their app(s), vendors have to contact the developer support team at go.atlassian.com/devhelp. 


h3. Suggested solution

It should be possible for app vendors/developers to edit the profile of the Atlassian Account of the user(s) created for their app(s) so that they can change these details by themselves.
fields.summary: It should be possible to edit the profile of the Atlassian Account of the user created for marketplace apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Given the set-up below:

* Self sign-up is enabled,
* the user has access to one application (let's say Confluence),
* and product access is set to give Jira Access to new users.  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

When the user happens to go to a Jira URL (and product access is set to give Jira Access to new users), it will gain a *Jira license*, as expected. However, this scenario *is not being tracked on Atlassian Access audit logs*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable self-sign up to a domain
# Enable Jira Access to New users
# Pick-up a user with a Confluence license only
# Have that user to access any Jira URL
# The user will gain access to Jira

h3. Expected Results
* This is a license changing event and should be tracked by audit logs as per [this document|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/track-organization-activities-from-the-audit-log/]

h3. Actual Results
* The license changing event is not tracked by audit logs

h3. Workaround
None at the moment. You may consider turning off the "New users have access to this product" switch.
fields.summary: Access granting sign-up scenario is not tracked by the audit log

fields.description:
Currently, there are no options for Administrators to automate the change (or signal the change) of email domain for JIRA/Confluence cloud and Atlassian Accounts.

Ideally, there would be a streamlined process that will signal to Atlassian Account that there is a change if the email domain to be used by users. Signaling to end-users to choose to use the new email as the new email for their Atlassian Account, or to create a new one, with details on the instance that called for the change.
fields.summary: Ability to Bulk Change Email Domain on Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Managed accounts synced through [User provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] can still edit some of the attributes such as:
- Job Title
- Department
- Organization
- Based In 

Other than *Based In* which is not supported yet, the other fields should be locked from edition to respect the information coming from the sync.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Lock *Job Title*, *Department*, and *Organization* the same way it happens to the *Full name* and *Email address* attributes.
fields.summary: Restrict users edition when the account is synced through User Provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Gravatar is used where a user has not uploaded an avatar or created a custom initials avatar. Some customers would like the option to not use the Gravatar service for user profile avatars.
h3. Workaround

Users need to either upload an avatar or create a custom initials avatar via the "Profile and visibility" page.
fields.summary: Identity platform still going through gravatars domain even after gravatars turned OFF
